newsitem.title: USA: United Petroleum drops merger talks.
newsitem.headline: United Petroleum drops merger talks.

text.p: United Petroleum Corp said Tuesday it had ended acquisition talks with Halwell Co Inc, saying it had not received documentation and audited financial statements from Halwell.
United Petroleum Chairman and President Michael Thomas said in a statement that purchasing Halwell would not be in the best interests of United Petroleum stockholders.
In August United Petroleum announced an agreement to buy Halwell for $7 million.
Halwell officials could not be reached for comment.
United Petroleum owns gas and oil mineral rights to about 61,000 acres in central and eastern Kentucky. Halwell, which is based in Marietta, Ohio, produces and distributes natural gas and oil.
A spokeswoman for Hallwell said later on Tuesday that the company expected to issue a written response on Wednesday.
